name: deadeningly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that prevents new ideas from developing: There is not a precise moment when the film goes from being mediocre to deadeningly humourless. Her new book, at first, feels deadeningly familiar.
More examplesFewer examplesWhy was this performance such a deadeningly unrewarding experience?The music was very energetic, but deadeningly repetitive.The film features another deadeningly dull performance from the star.The rooms have been decorated in the deadeningly bland style of an international hotel chain.
